result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul Martin Knowles

11:49 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nicholas M Zimmerman appeared by video for Paul Martin Knowles. Defendant Paul Martin Knowles appeared by video. Victim Witness in court. Victim appeared by Video. Court reviews case. ADA Rockow states all discovery has been provided. Atty Zimmerman states all discovery has been received but looking for additional information and has filed open records requests. Atty Zimmerman has hired private investigator. Court sets STC. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned 11:58 AM
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

10:19 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nicholas M Zimmerman appeared by video for Paul Martin Knowles. Defendant Paul Martin Knowles appeared by video. Victim Witness in Court. Victim appeared via zoom. Court reviews case. ADA Smestad states discovery has been provided. Atty Zimmerman states discovery provided and received offer and requests additional time for negotiations. Court sets STC. Court addresses Victim. Victim has no comments for today. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned 10:23 AM

Attorney Nicholas M Zimmerman in court, Defendant Paul Martin Knowles in court. Victim Witness appeared with Victim. Court reviews case. Atty Zimmerman waives further reading. Defendant understands. Enter NG. Waives speedy trial. Atty Zimmerman notes has not reviewed all discovery and requests additional time.  Court sets STC. Court confirms address and phone number Adjourned 01:19 PM

Arraignment on July 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:58 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: Nicholas M Zimmerman, DF: Paul Martin Knowles appeared. Victim Witness appears with Victim. S/T Deputy J.Smith (SCSO). Direct by ADA Ellenwood. Court notes record to reflect the identity of DE for todays purposes. Cross by Atty Zimmerman. Redirect by ADA Ellenwood. Recross by Atty Zimmerman. Witness excused. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Zimmerman notes no discovery has been provided at this time. Court sets ARGN. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned 03:17 PM.  Arraignment scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

for continuance of 5/17 PH. Filed by ADA Smestad. km
Per EFV on 5-9-2022: "Okay to reschedule" JA will reset w/ Attys. rg/km
Preliminary hearing on May 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  T.H., A.M, and residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:15 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY: Nicholas M Zimmerman, DF: Paul Martin Knowles appeared. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. De has retained private counsel. Bond arguments. Court orders bond. Court sets PH. Adjourned  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
